metadata.task_description: Add 3 subtasks to 'Frontend implementation' under project 'Website Redesign'

judgement.reasoning: The agent successfully completed all parts of the user's request. It navigated to the Asana URL, located the 'Website Redesign' project, found the 'Frontend implementation' task, and added exactly three subtasks ('Implement login screen', 'Integrate API endpoints', and 'Create state management'). The execution flow was logical and efficient, using appropriate clicks and input actions to navigate the task management interface. Screenshots were taken at major UI state changes, fulfilling the secondary requirement. The final result accurately reflects the successful completion of the task.

steps.title: Website Redesign - Asana

steps.title: Website Redesign - Frontend implementation - Asana
steps.description: I have successfully opened the 'Frontend implementation' task details panel on the right side of the screen. The current state is the task details view. My next goal is to add 3 subtasks. I see an "Add subtask" button (index 2426, and another one 2592 in the scrollable task details section). I will click the "Add subtask" button (index 2426) to start adding the subtasks. I will use the one near the top of the details panel.

steps.title: Website Redesign - Frontend implementation - Asana
steps.description:
I have successfully opened the 'Frontend implementation' task details panel and clicked 'Add subtask'. The current state shows an input field ready for the first subtask name. I need to add 3 subtasks. I will input the name for the first subtask, then press Enter (or click 'Add subtask' again if Enter doesn't create a new task line) and repeat for the next two subtasks. The input field for the subtask is not indexed, but the textarea for the first subtask is available as a shadow DOM element within the list item (index 2880). However, since I clicked 'Add subtask', the input field is already focused. I will try to input the task name into the focused element. Since the input field is not indexed, I will try to use the `send_keys` action to type the subtask name and then press Enter. I will use the subtask names: "Implement login screen", "Integrate API endpoints", and "Create state management".

Since I cannot directly input into the unindexed input field, I will use the indexed textarea (index 2880) which is for the first subtask that was created when I clicked "Add subtask".
